questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 35 cm and a width of 20 cm. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(length + width) = 2(35 + 20) = 2(55) = 110 cm

questions.question: The area of a square is 324 square meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side² = 324. Therefore, side = √324 = 18 meters. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 18 = 72 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 17 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Area of circle = πr² = (22/7) × 17 × 17 = 892 cm²

questions.question: The perimeter of a regular hexagon is 78 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular hexagon, all sides are equal. Perimeter = 6 × side length. Therefore, side length = 78 ÷ 6 = 13 cm

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 16 cm, 63 cm, and 65 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (16-63-65). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 16 × 63 = 500 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 240 square meters and its length is 20 meters. What is its width?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 240 ÷ 20 = 12 meters

questions.question: A circle has a diameter of 30 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter = (22/7) × 30 = 94 cm

questions.question: The area of a parallelogram is 144 square centimeters and its height is 16 centimeters. What is its base?
questions.explanation: Base = area ÷ height = 144 ÷ 16 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square has the same perimeter as a rectangle with length 26 cm and width 20 cm. What is the area of the square?
questions.explanation: Perimeter of rectangle = 2(26 + 20) = 92 cm. Side of square = 92 ÷ 4 = 23 cm. Area of square = 23 × 23 = 524 cm²

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 210 square meters. Its parallel sides are 30 meters and 40 meters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 210) ÷ (30 + 40) = 420 ÷ 70 = 6 meters

questions.question: A regular pentagon has a perimeter of 75 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular pentagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 5 = 75 ÷ 5 = 15 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 154 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 22/7)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 154. Therefore, r = 154 ÷ (2 × 22/7) = 24.5 cm. Area = πr² = (22/7) × 24.5 × 24.5 = 1882 cm²

questions.question: A rectangle has a perimeter of 66 cm and a width of 15 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Perimeter = 2(length + width). Therefore, length = (66 ÷ 2) - 15 = 18 cm. Area = length × width = 18 × 15 = 270 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rhombus is 132 square centimeters and one of its diagonals is 22 centimeters. What is the length of the other diagonal?
questions.explanation: Area of rhombus = (1/2) × product of diagonals. Therefore, other diagonal = (2 × area) ÷ given diagonal = (2 × 132) ÷ 22 = 12 cm

questions.question: A circle has an area of 907.46 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 907.46. Therefore, r² = 907.46 ÷ 3.14 = 289. Therefore, r = √289 = 17 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a rectangle is 58 cm and its area is 210 square centimeters. What are its dimensions?
questions.explanation: Let length = l and width = w. Then 2(l + w) = 58 and l × w = 210. Solving these equations gives l = 17 cm and w = 12 cm

questions.question: A regular octagon has a perimeter of 104 cm. What is the length of each side?
questions.explanation: In a regular octagon, all sides are equal. Side length = perimeter ÷ 8 = 104 ÷ 8 = 13 cm

questions.question: The area of a triangle is 72 square centimeters and its base is 16 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of triangle = (1/2) × base × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ base = (2 × 72) ÷ 16 = 9 cm

questions.question: A square and a rectangle have the same area. The rectangle has length 30 cm and width 12 cm. What is the perimeter of the square?
questions.explanation: Area of rectangle = 30 × 12 = 360 cm². Side of square = √360 = 18 cm. Perimeter of square = 4 × 18 = 72 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 106.76 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = π × diameter. Therefore, diameter = circumference ÷ π = 106.76 ÷ 3.14 = 34 cm

questions.question: A parallelogram has a base of 24 cm and a height of 18 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of parallelogram = base × height = 24 × 18 = 432 cm²

questions.question: The area of a circle is 314 square centimeters. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Area = πr² = 314. Therefore, r² = 314 ÷ 3.14 = 100. Therefore, r = √100 = 10 cm

questions.question: A rectangle has a length of 28 cm and an area of 252 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Width = area ÷ length = 252 ÷ 28 = 9 cm. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(28 + 9) = 74 cm

questions.question: The perimeter of a square is 92 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Side length = perimeter ÷ 4 = 92 ÷ 4 = 23 cm. Area = side² = 23 × 23 = 530 cm²

questions.question: A triangle has sides of length 15 cm, 112 cm, and 113 cm. What is its area?
questions.explanation: This is a right-angled triangle (15-112-113). Area = (1/2) × base × height = (1/2) × 15 × 112 = 840 cm²

questions.question: The area of a rectangle is 288 square meters and its width is 16 meters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Length = area ÷ width = 288 ÷ 16 = 18 meters. Perimeter = 2(length + width) = 2(18 + 16) = 76 meters

questions.question: A circle has a radius of 18 cm. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 2 × 3.14 × 18 = 113.2 cm

questions.question: The area of a trapezium is 270 square centimeters. Its parallel sides are 36 centimeters and 54 centimeters. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Area of trapezium = (1/2)(sum of parallel sides) × height. Therefore, height = (2 × area) ÷ (sum of parallel sides) = (2 × 270) ÷ (36 + 54) = 540 ÷ 90 = 6 cm

questions.question: A square has an area of 576 square centimeters. What is its perimeter?
questions.explanation: Side length = √576 = 24 cm. Perimeter = 4 × side = 4 × 24 = 96 cm

questions.question: The circumference of a circle is 125.6 cm. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14)
questions.explanation: Circumference = 2πr = 125.6. Therefore, r = 125.6 ÷ (2 × 3.14) = 20 cm
